solution_line_template: When the stadium is full, the total fees charged is {stadium_capacity}*${entry_fee_per_person} = ${<<{stadium_capacity}*{entry_fee_per_person}={full_stadium_fees}>>}{full_stadium_fees}.

When the stadium is {fraction_full_numerator}/{fraction_full_denominator} full, the total number of people in is {fraction_full_numerator}/{fraction_full_denominator}*{stadium_capacity} = <<{fraction_full_numerator}/{fraction_full_denominator}*{stadium_capacity}={people_at_three_quarters_full}>>{people_at_three_quarters_full} people.

The total entry fees collected when the stadium is 3/4 full is {people_at_three_quarters_full}*${entry_fee_per_person} = ${<<{people_at_three_quarters_full}*{entry_fee_per_person}={fees_at_three_quarters_full}>>}{fees_at_three_quarters_full}.

The difference in the total entry fees when the stadium is full and when it's 3/4 full is ${full_stadium_fees}-${fees_at_three_quarters_full} = ${<<{full_stadium_fees}-{fees_at_three_quarters_full}={difference_in_fees}>>}{difference_in_fees}.
